result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Owen Chapman

records.addlTxt: to: J.C.P.  Check #: 033297. arc   mailed this date.

8:20 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric L Newmark in court, Defendant Daniel Owen Chapman in court. Includes 21CF863, 21TR3905, 21TR3906, 22CF174, 22CF210, 22CF255. recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to 21CF863 Count 1: OWI 4th (346.63(1)(a) and22CF174 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping 946.49(1)(b) DJOC for 3 Years. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty to 21CF863 Count 1: OWI 4th (346.63(1)(a). Court finds Defendant guilty to 22CF174 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping 946.49(1)(b) and withholds sentence for a period of 3 Years on a DJOC. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 21TR3905 and 21TR3906 and dismissed and read-in 22CF210 and 22CF255. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
21CF863 Count 1: W/S 3 Years Probation

- 320 days condition time. 260 days Stayed. to commence today. Huber granted for work release and treatment
- Fine: $750.00. Inclusive of costs. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- Blood Draw Surcharge: $28.00, to SCSO. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample 
- AODA- completed and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Participate in Restorative Justice Program
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to possess a firearm
- Operating privileges revoked for 3 Years and IID for 3 years
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Maintain employment 
- Comply with terms in DJOC in case 22CF174
- Successfully complete drug court 
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation

DE remanded into custody.
3 days credit against ultimate sentence

21CF174 Count 1: 3 Year DJOC. 


Adjourned at : 09:00 AM

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

11:08 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Owen Chapman in court.  Attorney Eric L Newmark in court for Daniel Owen Chapman. Includes 21CF863, 21TR3905, 21TR3906, 22CF174, 22CF210, and 22CF255. Set for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Atty Newmark states cases are resolved, but DE wasn't aware that he would be remanded into custody upon sentencing, and requests to reset. Court resets Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Adjourned at 11:11 AM.  gll
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Request for Continuance of 6/14/22 PLEAS. Per EFV on 6-13-2022: "Okay to reschedule" JA will reset w/ Attys.  gll
via Zoom

11:3 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Eric L Newmark appeared by Zoom  DF:  Daniel Owen Chapman appeared by Zoom late. Includes 21CF863, 21TR3905, 21TR3906, 22CF174, 22CF210, and 22CF255. Court states DE is not on Zoom. Atty Newmark will send a message to Defendant. Atty Newmark states DE completed assessment and observed treatment court yesterday. Defendant appeared at 11:35 AM. ADA Brekken states DE does qualify for treatment court. Attys agree to set plea date. Court sets Plea/Sentencing Hearing in person. Defendant confirms address and phone number. ADA Brekken requests DE contact treatment court coordinator. Adjourned at 11:39 AM.  gll  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

12:57 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Eric L Newmark appeared via zoom, DF: Daniel Owen Chapman appeared via zoom. Includes 21CF863, 21TR3905, 21TR3906, 22CF174, 22CF210, and 22CF255. Court reviews case. Atty Newmark states DE has an assessment scheduled for the middle of May as DE is trying to get into Treatment Court. ADA Brekken requests to schedule no more than 30 days out. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 01:08PM  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

02:45 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Eric L Newmark   DF:  Daniel Owen Chapman appeared.  Includes 21CF863 STC, 21TR3905 STC, 21TR3906 STC, 22CF174 ARNG, 22CF210 STC, and 22CF255 STC. Court reviews case. 22CF174: Waives reading. Enter NG plea. Reserve on pre-plea rights.  22CF210 and 22CF255: Court notes cases need PH. Atty Newmark waives time limits. Atty Newmark has submitted treatment court application. Court addresses pretrial violations. Court states if another violation happens. Court to issue warrant immediately. Adjourned 02:53 PM  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:31 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: Eric L Newmark appeared via zoom, DF: Daniel Owen Chapman appeared via zoom. Includes 21CF863 STC, 21TR3905 STC, 21TR3906 STC, and 22CF174 (PH). Court reviews case. 22CF174: Atty Newmark wavies PH. Court accepts waiver of PH. DE waives personal appearance. 21CF863, 21TR3905, 21TR3906, and 22CF174: ADA Brekken to file information with same charges in 22CF174. Court sets ARGN in case 22CF174 and STC 21CF863. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 02:39 PM  Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:08 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Eric L Newmark appears via zoom, DF: Daniel Owen Chapman appeared from jail. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE obtained private counsel. Waive reading. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court quashed warrant. Court JUTR to Branch II. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
